result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Schuster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: This sentence is to be served consecutive to any other sentence in being.

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution in the amount of $2417.64 to Austin H. Hanus
--to pay 10 % restitution processing fee
: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--  to obtain/ maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--not to consume or possess any alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--not to possess or consume any illegal drugs
--monthly testing for illegal drug use during first 12 months of supervision, after that time period at the discretion of the Agent
--no contact with Austin H. Hanus
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

  Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.

Transcript of 6/30/15 Plea and Sentencing Hearing

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: With JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 15CF34 and 15CF80 called together at 2:03pm [mo]
Defendant Nicholas A Schuster in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock submits an Amended Information for each case
Atty. De La Rosa admits service and waives reading of both

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; pleas of "No Contest" entered on Case 15CF34 Counts #5 & #6 of the Amended Information and Case 15CF80 Counts #2 and #3 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Schuster guilty, and orders Judgment of Convictions entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: the remaining counts of both cases

Sentencing arguments by ADA Shock
--ADA Shock submits Victim Impact Statement; the Court reviews
--ADA Shock submits Exhibit #1(bar surveillance video)
--On agreement of parties, the Court Reporter does not need to record the audio of video
--Video played from 2:23pm -2:25pm
Sentencing arguments by Atty. De La Rosa 


On Case 15CF34 Count #5: The Court sentences Mr. Schuster   to  6  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of   3 years.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to any other sentence in being. 
On Case 15CF34 Count #6: The Court sentences Mr. Schuster   to  6  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of   3 years.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to the sentence in Count #5
On Case 15CF80 Count #2 : The Court sentences Mr. Schuster   to  2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of   1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of   1 year.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to the sentence in 15CF34
On Case 15CF80 Count #3: The Court sentences Mr. Schuster   to  2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of   1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of   1 year.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to the sentence in 15CF34 and sentence in Count #2

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

On Case 15CF34: The Court gives  82   days credit for time already served.
On Case 15CF80: The Court gives   1  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
-- to obtain/ maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--not to consume or possess any alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--not to possess or consume any illegal drugs
--monthly testing for illegal drug use during first 12 months of supervision, after that time period at the discretion of the Agent
--no contact with Austin H. Hanus
--to pay restitution in the amount of $2417.64 to Austin H. Hanus
--to pay 10 % restitution processing fee
--On Case 15CF34 Count #5: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--On Case 15CF34 Count #6: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--On Case 15CF80 Count #2: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--On Case 15CF80 Count #3: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge plus $25 drug testing fee
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 2:48pm
from ADA Shock with attached Amended Information
The Court is willing to grant the request to "move up" the court dates if the attorneys agree and if there is compliance with the Victims rights. Attorneys are to Contact the JA
Letter from the def re scheduling

Cases 15CF80 & 15CF34 called together at 9:22 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Nicholas A Schuster in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa: Requests matter be set for additional STC, presents basis as negotiations are on-going
DA Happ: No objection
Atty De La Rosa confirms waiver of speedy trial
Court continues bond
Recess: 9:25 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC 6/30/15 at 9:15 am - Send notices
Status conference on May 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Cases 15CF34 and 15CF80 called together at 9:06am[mo]
 Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Nicholas A Schuster in court, in custody with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to both cases: 
Mr. Schuster waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Informations in each case admitted, reading waived as to both
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on both cases

The Court reviews Mr. Schuster's bond and its conditions
recess: 9:12am 

NEXT:  Status Conference on May 29, 2015 at 9:00am
Preliminary hearing on May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cases 15CF34 & 15CF80 called together at 2:07 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Nicholas A Schuster in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CF34 - On State's Motion to Modify Bond: 
Arguments by Counsel

Court presents basis, grants motion to modify bond and requires a $5,000 CASH bond, with conditions:
--not to committ any acts of violence or make any threats
--no possession of dangerous weapons
--no contact with the co-defendant David Berg except through a lawyer
--no contact with Austin Hanus, Cara Tetzlaff, Brynn Neevel or Jessica Melchior, except through a lawyer
--no presence at Gasthaus Bar
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

As to BOTH cases:
Counsel requests that matters be set for STC; Court informs parties that It will set matter for preliminary hearing
Recess: 2:36 pm

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 5/8/15 at 8:30 am  - Send notices

Case called at 10:52 am [Clerk SH]
Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Schuster was not able to obtain ride for today's hearing, but does have arrangements for STC tomorrow
ADA Hall requests bench warrant, but have that warrant STAYED until 4/10/15 at 2:00 pm and hear arguments on bond modification tomorrow
Court orders issuance of bench warrant, and STAYS this warrant until 2:00 pm on 4/10/15 - Court will hear motion to modify bond at tomorrow's STC as well.
Recess: 10:57 am  Motion hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on April 9, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Motion hearing on April 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 25, 2015 at 09:20 am.

Defendant Nicholas A Schuster in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attt Zarwell requests additional DA PTC & STC, presents basis including issues with video
ADA Teuber: Agreed

Case called at 1:41pm
Judge Koschnick presiding for Branch II
Defendant Nicholas A Schuster appears via videoconferencing from Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell.  Public Service Prosector Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--not to committ any acts of violence or make any threats
--no possession of dangerous weapons
--no contact with the co-defendant David Berg except through a lawyer
--no contact with Austin Hanus, Cara Tetzlaff, Brynn Neevel or Jessica Melchior, except through a lawyer
--no presence at Gasthaus Bar
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
recess 1:48  pm.
